text: Chaetopappa pulchella is a North American species of plants in the sunflower family. It found only in the State of (Coahuila in northern Mexico.Shinners, Lloyd Herbert 1946. Wrightia 1(2): 79–80Tropicos, Chaetopappa pulchella Shinners The International Plant Names Index Chaetopappa pulchella grows on the bottoms of canyons and ravines in the Chihuahuan Desert. It is a small plant rarely more than 7 cm (2.8 inches) tall though possessing a taproot and hence perhaps capable of surviving inhospitable seasons to act as a perennial. Flower heads have lavender ray florets and yellow disc florets. ==References== Category:Astereae Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Flora of Coahuila Category:Flora of the Chihuahuan Desert Category:Plants described in 1946
